reference.title: javaClassAccess
reference.shortdesc: The <javaClassAccess> element provides the ClassModifiersopt for the declaration of the class access values.

section.title: Description
section.p: A class declaration can include the following modifiers: public, abstract, or final. Fields, methods, member class, member interface, and constructor declaration can include the access modifiers public, protected, or private.

refbody.example:
ExampleClick on the following link to open the Java API topic type example in
<javaClass id="com.ibm.xtools.viz.ui"> <apiName>UMLDiagramResourceUtil</apiName> <shortdesc>A utility class that exposes UML diagram resource lifecycle operations and provides access to the modeling platform.</shortdesc> <javaClassDetail> <javaClassDef> <javaFinalClass /> <javaClassAccess value="public"/> <javaBaseClass href="../Object.html" format=”html”>Object</javaBaseClass> </javaClassDef> <apiDesc>API clients should not instantiate this class.</apiDesc> </javaClassDetail> </javaClass>
